availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Cambron (Union County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Raphael Cambron and Mary Cambron. Married to Joanna (Ann) D. Wathen Cambron in Union County, Kentucky, on February 23, 1857. Father of Raphael Cambron, William T. Cambron. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 505A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 341.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 332.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 402A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562203.
